Resolved Question Show me another » What is the Average pay rate in the U.S? I have been told that pay rates are really bad for the average worker, what are the hourly rates? What do you do? 4 years ago Report Abuse by Isolde Member since: 26 June 2008 Total points: 1,132 (Level 3) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters An average worker doing what job? The amount of pay someone receives for a job depends on the individual's level of experience doing the assigned work, what type of work is being done, and how much education the individual has. Higher levels in any of these areas will result in higher pay.
The minimum wage in the U.S. is $6.55 per hour, which will go up to $7.25 per hour on July 24, 2009. This just means that an employer cannot pay an individual on hourly wage, rather than salary, less than this amount for any work performed. Minimum wage jobs usually require less education, less experience, and less responsibility to do the work for that particular position. You find some of the fast food restaurant workers, assembly line workers, and general laborers making minimum wage...basically, young workers (high school age) and individuals just entering the workforce are usually employed in minimum wage jobs. In actuality, it's nearly impossible to live, i.e., pay bills and eat, making only minimum wage. The cost of living in the U.S. is too high. 4 years ago Report Abuse 100% 1 Vote 3 people rated this as good
